alert.note: Alert for Frontier (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 19 at 9:33PM CDT by NWS NorthPlatte
info.description: ...Strong outflow winds from a line of showers will impact portions of Frontier, eastern Perkins, southeastern Keith, eastern Chase, southwestern Lincoln and Hayes Counties through 1015 PM CDT/915 PM MDT/... At 931 PM CDT/831 PM MDT/, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 8 miles south of Madrid to 10 miles west of Danbury. Movement was northeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and areas of blowing dust. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Imperial, Curtis, Hayes Center, Sutherland, Hershey, Wauneta, Paxton, Wallace, Madrid, Elsie, Wellfleet, Moorefield, Stockville, Dickens, Enders Reservoir State Recreation Area, Sarben, Medicine Creek Reservoir State Recreation Area, Enders, Sutherland Reservoir State Recreation Area and Champion. This includes the following highways... Highway 61 between mile markers 25 and 53. Interstate 80 in Nebraska between mile markers 143 and 166. Highway 83 between mile markers 27 and 72. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
